phrase.cizu_name: six of one and half a dozen of the other

jx.jx_en_mean: used to convey that there is little real difference between two alternatives
In a state of confusion or disorder.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English siex, six, syx, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zes and German sechs, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin sex and Greek hex

encyclopedia.content: 基本信息 专辑：《Six》 歌手：曼森合唱团 发行：EMI百代唱片 时间：1998-07-09 语种：欧美 流派：摇滚 地区：欧美 专辑介绍 Six是唯一张能与划时代的经典Ok Computer(1997)相抗衡的专辑，同样是出生Britpop的Mansun和Radiohead都各在这两张专辑做下两种不一样的概念、实验、前卫风格，当然"Ok Computer"相当受到媒体的重视，几乎票选100大专辑它都榜上有名。整张专辑分为两大部分，Part1开头曲"Six"长达8分

example.ex: ...a glorious career spanning more than six decades.
example.tran: 延续 60 余载的辉煌事业

entry.tran: (板球中)得 6 分的击球，以 6 分记的击球
entry.def: In cricket, if a player hits a six, they score six runs by hitting the ball so that it crosses the boundary at the edge of the playing area before it touches the ground.

entry.tran: 使颇为不安;使受严重影响
entry.def: If someone or something is hit for six or knocked for six, they are very upset or badly affected by an experience or piece of news.

example.ex: The loss of my wife hit me for six; it took me months to recover...
example.tran: 丧妻之痛令我彻底崩溃，几个月之后才恢复过来。

example.ex: Many areas in the North were knocked for six by that first recession.
example.tran: 北部的许多地区在第一次大萧条中损失惨重。

entry.tran: 困惑的;混乱的;杂乱无章的
entry.def: If you say that someone or something is at sixes and sevens, you mean that they are confused or disorganized.

example.ex: The government is at sixes and sevens over the issue of domestic security.
example.tran: 在国内安全问题上，政府一片混乱。

means.word_mean: 1. the cardinal number that is the sum of five and one
1. denoting a quantity consisting of six items or units

Sentence.sentence: At the age of six she started reading the daily financial newspapers and opened her own bank account.
Six 4-H girls worked to clean the 72 foot curbside that was covered with weeds, rocks and trash.

sentences.cn: 我看了一下手表，已经6 点多了。

sentences.en: It really hit me for six to find that my father had written about me in his book.
sentences.cn: 我发现父亲居然在他的书里写到了我，这的确令我深感意外。

means.word_mean: 彻底毁掉(某个计划、主意、建议等)；撞倒某人/某物

sentences.en: The stock market crash has hit the economy for six.
sentences.cn: 股市崩盘给了经济以沉重的打击。

sentences.en: Toby took a step backwards and knocked the video camera for six.
sentences.cn: 托比后退了一步，将摄像机撞翻在地。

sentences.en: Patrick said John started the fight, but I think it was probably six of one and half a dozen of the other.
sentences.cn: 帕特里克说是约翰先动手的，可是我看他俩很可能是半斤对八两，都有错。

sentences.en: I’ve tried both ways of getting to Oxford and as far as I can see it’s six of one and half a dozen of the other (= they both take the same time).
sentences.cn: 去牛津的两条路我都试过了，我看距离差不了多少。

sentences.en: By then, all the witnesses were six feet under.
sentences.cn: 到那时，所有的证人都埋在了黃土之下。
